title: Are reality and fantasy mutually exclusive? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, nicely expressed parable. I like it ! My answer will fall a bit in the ‘parabolic’ arena too.  The answer from my heart ! I do know that they can ‘dance’ together and being well familiar with that very dance floor ( I am going to even toss in ‘Objective Understanding’ into the mix). They can ‘boogie’ well, and occasionally even pull off a slow dance together. One is powered by the ‘brain’, one from the emotions, and one from a pure heart. Dance yes, become ‘married’ . . . Nope. Why? because their ‘outcomes’ will eventually supersede each other. (you know, the old searching in the ‘underwear’ drawer) deal. The friendship will then become sour. But ‘non judgmental respect’ can allow them to be able to still say “HI” to each other without starting a ‘fist fight’. Does that help get a bit closer to the answer you are searching for? How might I know? Well, I am married to Objective Understanding, and truly do Understand. Fist Fights used to be a part of of my/the grand finale (when I was an x-tian). Each has a right to make their own choices and it is greater to just learn how to become aware of the ‘train wreck’ damage that just isn’t well paying. The birds and the trees and the sky aren’t the same either . . . but they can still exist with a bit of appreciation of one another. I think that is why Hamashiach told Peter . . . you will eat with what seems non-kosher to you. Hey, You have a great day. from that damn Jew boy (:

how can fantasy exclude reality?! Whatever the fantasy, it cannot happen outside reality but this doesn’t make it real. Fantasy is the attribute of the mind; reality is not an attribute- it is the immutable ‘background/space’ in which the entire play of consciousness manifests [that which you perceive happening as… perception, regardless of its content- because if you are focussed on the content, you cannot ‘see’ reality beyond it and stay trapped in the world of ever changing fantasy, fascinated by its hocus-pocus]

You can have a real fantasy, and you can act out a fantasy in reality. It depends on how you are using the words. If you choose a definition that is mutually exclusive then yes, otherwise probably not. What I am saying is that the words are used so many ways in normal conversation that it is impossible to guess which use you are making of them now… the question is vague.

No, one can have maximised use of the left logical/positive brain so live in reality but still have a little left brain fantasy, if one is using the faulty right anxious/negative delusional brain one is not realistic and fantasy is often delusional and harmful. I keep my left brain use maximised with EGMi, I live in reality and allow myself a little fantasy as treat now and again.

From a dictionary point of you, yes. The whole point of fantasy is that it is imagination rather than reality. However, All fantasy is to some degree based in reality. Fantasy, as devised by a human, will inevitably still include some aspects of the human experience.

Yes. And no. I believe fantasy is the seed some reality sprout from.Many things happen in life that seem unreachable are actually obtained by an individual through the thought process. What is the difference between a “dream” and “fantasy” ? To me the only thing is a “fantasy” has been labeled that because whatever it is, it's harder to make a reality than a fantasy.
No. The former has no need for the later, while the later is completely dependent on the former. There is reality with or without fantasy, but there is no fantasy without reality.
